publicationStmt.p: Copyright 1908, By Friendship Calendar Co.New Britain Conn.

handDesc.handNote: Written in cursive and has underlines highlighting key words. Is in black ink and is in cursive.
Written in mostly capital letters, execept for one "i." Main text is written in black ink and is printed.

additions.locus: The left-hand side of this sheet has a drawing of Mary Behrend in Snowshoes. On the right is the written text.

Throughout the sheet, there are doodles of snakes and three leaf clovers. There are two snakes and two clovers above the text, one clover within the text, and one clover after. At the bottom right hand side, there is a drawing of the Hammermill Paper Company with the last line of text beneath it.

div.p: (March 11) "Erie Tea" is a key phrase that I noticed was underlined.
(March 12) Since "snowshoes" are necessary here, it must have snowed quite a bit. Erie never changes.
